subject: multiple test suites
msgSnippet: Hello dear members! Is there a clever way to code multiple test suites in the same class? I have a package test grouping all test that are in the same package.
messageBody:
Hello dear members!
Is there a clever way to code multiple test suites in the same class?
I have a package test grouping all test that are in the same package.
Currently i am only defining multiple suite methots which get called by
the runner in the main.

Here is an example:

public PackageTest(String name) { super(name); }

public static Test serverSuite() {
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
suite.addTestSuite(BLabla3Test.class);
suite.addTestSuite(Blabla4Test.class);

}

public static Test suite() {
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
suite.addTestSuite(BLabla1Test.class);
suite.addTestSuite(Blabla2Test.class);
TestSetup wrapper = new TestSetup(suite) {
protected void setUp() {
TestDBGenerator.main(
new String[] { "create" });
}
protected void tearDown() {
TestDBGenerator.main(
new String[] { "drop" });
}
};
return wrapper;


}

public static void main(String[] args) {
TestRunner runner = new TestRunner();
runner.run(serverSuite());
// runner.run(suite());
}
